page.title: 09Work outside farming
page.content: {F.Heard & Co (Agricultural Suppliers) moved from{Hartland}to Morwenstow in 1916 and is now run by the founder's son. Recently there were 20 full-time workers but some are now part-time. All are fairly local. Farmers within a 20-mile radius are supplied mainly with goods bought wholesale; some pro- cessing is also done on the site. The village postmistress, the only {Post Office }employee, remembers when five postmen were based in Morwenstow. {Gooseham Barton Stables}(started 1972) has two full time and three part time workers.There are thirty horses on 30 acres. The{Bush Inn}has 2 full time employees and, during the season, several part time.{Rectory Tea Rooms}employ up to 5 part time but close in winter. {Paul Heard }employs an apprentice in servicing farm machinery.
